title: Ticket #3311: DAGManNodesMask is not working correctly
description:
We have the following set in jobs submitted by DAGMan: 
DAGManNodesMask = "0,1,5,9,12,13,16"
This means that the dagman log is only supposed to see events with those numbers. But, in LMCG, I have the following in the log. 
006 (013.000.000) 11/08 13:58:15 Image size of job updated: 11356
006 (014.000.000) 11/08 13:58:15 Image size of job updated: 1
006 (014.000.000) 11/08 14:03:16 Image size of job updated: 3363552
006 (013.000.000) 11/08 14:03:16 Image size of job updated: 3400724
006 (013.000.000) 11/08 14:08:17 Image size of job updated: 3400724
006 (014.000.000) 11/08 14:08:17 Image size of job updated: 3458656
006 (013.000.000) 11/08 14:18:17 Image size of job updated: 3429484
006 (014.000.000) 11/08 14:18:17 Image size of job updated: 3460768
006 (013.000.000) 11/08 14:28:18 Image size of job updated: 3429484
006 (013.000.000) 11/08 14:33:18 Image size of job updated: 3429484
006 (013.000.000) 11/08 14:43:20 Image size of job updated: 3443060
006 (014.000.000) 11/08 14:43:20 Image size of job updated: 3467976
006 (014.000.000) 11/08 14:53:21 Image size of job updated: 3467976
006 (015.000.000) 11/08 15:15:22 Image size of job updated: 1
006 (015.000.000) 11/08 15:20:22 Image size of job updated: 5759356
006 (015.000.000) 11/08 15:25:23 Image size of job updated: 5759408
So, the masking does not seem to be working correctly.
remarks:
2012-Nov-09 08:26:08 by nwp:
Looks like I took out the code that handles the mask attribute when I "fixed" #3111. I wrote a fix and ran it through NMI last night; everything is green. Once I get clearance from TJ, I will put it in 7.9.2.

2012-Nov-16 12:41:59 by wenger:
Hey, I have a concern about the whole DAGManNodesMask idea in general -- this might break Pegasus. I'm going to check with them, but it looks like they want to see GRID_SUBMIT and GLOBUS_SUBMIT events.

Also, what's the purpose of DAGManNodesMask? Just to make the log file smaller? And is it something we want to document for users?

2012-Nov-16 14:12:36 by nwp:
Yes, the point of DAGManNodesMask is to limit the amount of information DAGMan digests. If the user does not define a log, then dagman.nodes.log will contain all the events. If the user does define a log, the events will go into the UserLog. The idea is that DAGMan has its own log that it is using for its own purposes. In particular, Pegasus should use the UserLog if both UserLog and DAGManNodeLog are defined in the job classad.

2012-Nov-16 14:14:46 by nwp:
As far as documenting it, it is documented already, similar to DAGManJobId and such, that is useful for DAGMan (only).

2012-Nov-16 15:29:53 by wenger:
Okay, I'm going to turn back on the logging of the events that Pegasus wants to see. As far as I know right now it's just the GLOBUS_SUBMIT and GRID_SUBMIT events, so it shouldn't make that much difference to the log file size.

2012-Nov-19 08:05:47 by nwp:
Pegasus should not be looking at DAGMan's log. So ULOG_GLOBUS_SUBMIT and ULOG_GRID_SUBMIT do not need to be in the mask.

2012-Nov-19 11:13:32 by wenger:
Pegasus currently still parses the dagman.out file (I just checked with Karan about this). The plan is that Pegasus should switch over to having DAGMan generate the jobstate.log file, and look at that. Either way, any event that Pegasus needs to see needs to be in the DAG node log file.

2012-Nov-20 09:38:30 by wenger:
Hmm -- it just occurred to me that we should document that the DAGMan node log file doesn't have all of the events, so users don't get confused if they happen to notice that.

2012-Nov-20 14:02:41 by wenger:
I've updated the definition of DAGManNodesMask, so as far as I'm concerned this is all set to go.

2012-Nov-20 14:24:11 by nwp:
Changes look fine to me.
